title: The state of Zephyr
body:
So far I've noticed that not many people build Zephyr unless it's a luxury item (or you're playing Hide & Seek), and overall is considered a "meh" item. What would be some things that could be changed for it to be a more lucrative item to help fill the role of AD/Tenacity item a bit better? 

Personally, I say a boost to the movement speed (think 5-10%).

replies.body: I was thinking an on-hit MS buff that stacks five times 5%/10%/15%/20%/25%/

I really love this idea:

{{item:3134}} + {{item:1043}} + 563g = {{item:3172}}  3000g

Stats	
+25 attack damage
+50% attack speed
+10% movement speed
+10% cooldown reduction

UNIQUE: 10 Armor Penetration
Passive	UNIQUE - TENACITY: The duration of most forms of crowd control is reduced by 35%.

Passive UNIQUE: Your basic attack deals 10 bonus physical damage and give a MS buff that stacks five times 5%/10%/15%/20%/25% by 6 seconds.
Would you also leave the passive movement speed in or have only the stacking mechanic?

It's a good item, it's just not used because there are better alternatives. It doesn't give enough AD to satisfy people who would build hydra/bt/ie, it has no crit, no armor pen, no lifesteal, and its passive is nowhere near as good as that of BORK which has nearly identical stats. Just increasing the AD a bit would help a lot, but that would make its gold efficiency rediculously high. I don't think a boost to the movement speed would help very much at all, it would just be regarded as a better upgrade for boots. Increasing its attack speed wouldn't help too much either, as it has nothing which increased attack speed would work well with.

...speaking of which, I've had an idea. Give it an additional passive which is similar to wits end, except movement speed instead of magic resistance. Could then be made to build out of phage instead of pickaxe as well, which would be useful as it would give phage an additional build path rather than forcing the player down the triforce route.
The phage idea is actually great, now if only we could get a Red in on this....
I agree! It is a beautiful idea.

I made a new thread with the idea in order to give it a bit more attention after the positive reinforcement from you two :)

http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/AsiuVov7-making-zephyr-a-better-item-killing-2-birds-with-one-stone

> [{quoted}](name=HeraldOne,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=0WaEvLbr,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2015-03-27T00:58:21.052+0000)
>
> Zephyr is an alternative to boots for champions who already have high base MS -Miss Fortune and Yi come to mind) and offers a fair amount of stats for its cost although its build path is horrendous.

Uh nice insight dude I've never thought of taking Zephyr to replace boots for champs that have high MS

The MR from mercs is nearly nonexistant, I would choose zephyr over those every time. I'd be more interested in the enchanted boots, the furor enchantment or the homeguard enchantment are really nice.

It's a beast on Yi once he's full build and has enough money to sell his boots and buy a Zephyr instead.  He'll still move plenty fast, especially with Youmuu's and his ultimate active.

It's just one of those items that gives a combination of things not useful to very many champions.  Tenacity is generally a tank thing and yet most of the other stats are strictly for damage dealers.  So it can only be used on a damage dealer but since it gives stuff other than damage you'll just deal less damage with it than some other damage item.  So nobody really wants it unless it can replace some less useful item in your build, like Yi's boots.
Ill probably leave it in and see the state of the item since no one builds it if it is OP I would take out the passive MS or reduce it
I think it's an alright last item
It's a luxury item prob because you can get tenacity for less on boots, and because tenacity doesn't stack between items.
